meanings.definition: The act of dividing a book or text into chapters.
meanings.sent1: In the novel, the author's chaptering helped readers follow the story easily.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy the chaptering in this book because it breaks up the content nicely.
meanings.sent3: The chaptering in the cookbook made it seem like each recipe was a mini adventure.
meanings.sent4: Her chaptering of the report was like creating a roadmap for the reader.
meanings.sent5: The chaptering of the manual made it much simpler to understand the complex instructions.

meanings.definition: The process of organizing information into distinct sections.
meanings.sent1: Effective chaptering of the data made it easier to analyze.
meanings.sent2: The chaptering of the presentation helped the audience grasp the main points.
meanings.sent3: The chaptering of the files on the computer was like tidying up a messy room.
meanings.sent4: Her chaptering of the project plan was like creating a clear roadmap for success.
meanings.sent5: The chaptering of the timeline made it simple to see the progression of events.

meanings.definition: The practice of structuring a narrative into separate parts.
meanings.sent1: The chaptering of the story added suspense to each section.
meanings.sent2: I appreciate the chaptering of the movie as it kept me engaged throughout.
meanings.sent3: The chaptering of the play made it feel like a series of interconnected scenes.
meanings.sent4: Her chaptering of the novel was like painting a vivid picture with words.
meanings.sent5: The chaptering of the poem made each stanza feel like a standalone masterpiece.
